title: Authors and Citation
text: Abiraahmi Shankar. Author, maintainer. Catalina Cañizares. Author. Francisco Cardozo. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shankar , Cañizares C, Cardozo F (2025). DedooseR: DedooseR Qualitative data monitoring & analysis. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {DedooseR: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis},   author = {Abiraahmi Shankar and Catalina Cañizares and Francisco Cardozo},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

what: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: DedooseR R package connects Dedoose support analysis qualitative data. built help researchers streamline workflows improve transparency rigor qualitative coding analysis.

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: DedooseR currently supports: Summarize codes coder Cleaning data exported Dedoose calculating code frequencies Setting saturation criteria Plotting saturation according set critera Producing code co-occurrence heatmaps

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: Viewing organizing excerpts interactive table Developing codebooks Calculating reliability per coder (Cohen’s kappa) coders (Fleiss’ kappa)

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: Ongoing challenges qualitative research include defining constitutes high-quality data demonstrating transparency saturation reached (Small & Calarco, 2022). Informed guidelines high-quality qualitative research (Hennink & Kaiser, 2022), DedooseR pays particular attention indicators like: concreteness excerpts (priority code) heterogeneity within codes (heterogeneity code) tagging indicators Dedoose exploring R, able gain greater confidence depth diversity dataset. Note: package currently requires concreteness heterogeneity tagged Dedoose, soon relaxing functionality can use package even without (though strongly recommend reasons stated ).

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: can install development version DedooseR GitHub :

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: basic example shows may package:
code: library(DedooseR)  # Load excerpts and co-occurence datasets from Dedoose excerpts <- read_xlsx("file path") cooccurence <- read_xlsx("file path")  # Summarize codes (total counts across coders and 1 coder/transcript according # to listed coder preference) preferred_coders <- c("s", "r", "l", "a") summarize_codes(excerpts, preferred_coders, output_type = "datatable")  # If you've been tagging excerpts by quality indicators, set them below and  # summarize code counts based on these selections quality_indicators(   excerpts = excerpts,   preferred_coders = preferred_coders,   qual_indicators = c("Priority excerpt", "Heterogeniety") )                                           # Plot code frequencies plot_saturation(excerpts)  # Set saturation criteria set_saturation(excerpts, min_priority = 10, min_heterogeneity = 10, plot = FALSE)  # Produce code co-occurence heat map cooccur(cooccur, min_frequency = 10)

title: DedooseR for Qualitative data monitoring & analysis
text: Hennink, M., & Kaiser, B. N. (2022). Sample sizes saturation qualitative research: systematic review empirical tests. Social science & medicine, 292, 114523. Small, M. L., & Calarco, J. M. (2022). Qualitative Literacy: Guide Evaluating Ethnographic Interview Research (1st ed.). University California Press. https://doi.org/10.2307/j.ctv2vr9c4x

title: Plot Code Co-occurrence Heatmap — coccur
text: Plot Code Co-occurrence Heatmap

title: Plot Code Co-occurrence Heatmap — coccur
Plot Code Co-occurrence Heatmap — coccur
text: file_path String path Excel file containing co-occurrence matrix. sheet Integer string specifying sheet number name (default: 1). min_frequency Numeric; minimum frequency threshold display heatmap (default: 5). code_labels Optional named vector data.frame mapping codes readable labels. named vector: names original codes, values labels. data.frame: must columns 'Code' 'Label'.

title: Plot Code Co-occurrence Heatmap — coccur
text: ggplot2 heatmap object visualizing code co-occurrences threshold.

what: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation
title: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation
text: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart

title: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation
Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation
text: long_codes data frame output create_saturation_tracking()

title: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation
text: ggplot object showing stacked bar chart Priority Heterogeneity code counts

title: Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — plot_saturation

what: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
text: function analyzes coding excerpts data, filters keep excerpts preferred coders (order preference), summarizes frequently specified quality indicator codes applied excerpts.

title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
code: quality_indicators(   excerpts = NULL,   preferred_coders = NULL,   qual_indicators = NULL )

title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
text: excerpts data frame containing excerpt coding data, including columns named like "Code: <Indicator> Applied" (e.g., "Code: Priority excerpt Applied"). preferred_coders character vector specifying coder names order preference. media title, excerpts highest-ranked coder kept. qual_indicators character vector quality indicator code names (without "Code: " prefix "Applied" suffix). example: c("Priority excerpt", "Heterogeniety").

title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
text: tibble summarizing counts excerpts coded code, along counts specified quality indicator applied, grouped code.

title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
text: function: Validates presence quality indicator columns data. Filters excerpts include preferred coder per media title. Converts wide code columns long format. Flags excerpts quality indicator applied. Summarizes returns counts often code appears along counts quality indicators applied.

title: Summarize Quality Indicators Applied to Excerpts by Preferred Coders — quality_indicators
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ excerpts <- readxl::read_xlsx("path/to/excerpts.xlsx") preferred_coders <- c("s", "r", "l", "a") quality_indicators(   excerpts = excerpts,   preferred_coders = preferred_coders,   qual_indicators = c("Heterogeniety", "Priority excerpt", "Knowledge/Awareness") ) } # }

what: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
title: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
text: function filters saturation tracking data based user-defined minimum counts Priority Heterogeneity codes, plots stacked bar chart showing filtered codes meeting thresholds.

title: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
code: set_saturation(   long_codes,   min_priority = 3,   min_heterogeneity = 3,   plot = TRUE )

title: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
text: long_codes data frame output create_saturation_tracking() containing columns Code, Priority_Count, Heterogeneity_Count. min_priority Integer. Minimum count threshold Priority codes include. Default 3. min_heterogeneity Integer. Minimum count threshold Heterogeneity codes include. Default 3. plot Logical. Whether create display plot. TRUE (default), creates stacked bar chart. FALSE, returns filtered data frame.

title: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
text: plot = TRUE, returns ggplot object (invisibly) showing stacked bar chart Priority Heterogeneity code counts codes meeting thresholds. plot = FALSE, returns data frame filtered codes counts.

title: Set Saturation Thresholds and Plot Saturation Tracking Bar Chart — set_saturation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ long_codes <- create_saturation_tracking("path/to/data.xlsx", c("coder1", "coder2")) set_saturation(long_codes, min_priority = 3, min_heterogeneity = 2) } # }

what: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
title: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
text: function summarizes many times code applied coder, presents data wide format: one row per code, one column per coder, along two total count columns: Total count coders (regardless preference) Total count preferred coders (one coder per media title, selected order preference)

title: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
code: summarize_codes(   excerpts,   preferred_coders = NULL,   output_type = c("tibble", "kable", "datatable") )

title: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
text: excerpts data frame coded excerpts, typically read Excel file. Must include column Excerpt Creator indicating coded excerpt, column Media Title identifying transcript, columns prefixed Code: code (binary indicators). preferred_coders character vector coder names preferred order, used resolve duplicates multiple coders coded transcript. output_type string indicating output format: one "tibble", "kable", "datatable". Defaults "tibble".

title: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
text: table summarizing number times code applied coder, including total counts coders preferred coders . format depends output_type.

title: Summarize Code Counts by Coder and from Preferred Coders — summarize_codes
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ excerpts <- readxl::read_xlsx("data/my_coded_excerpts.xlsx") preferred_coders <- c("s", "r", "l", "a") summarize_codes(excerpts, preferred_coders, output_type = "datatable") } # }
